services.title: Services
services.description: A map with service names as keys and Service configs as values. You can have any number of services listed here as long as service name keys start with a lowercase letter and contain only letters numbers and underscores. You can use `fluence service add` command to add a service to this config

additionalProperties.title: Service config
additionalProperties.description: Service config. Defines where the service is and how to deploy it

get.description: Path to service directory or URL to the tar.gz archive with the service

totalMemoryLimit.description: Memory limit for all service modules. If you specify this property please make sure it's at least `2 MiB * numberOfModulesInTheService`. In repl default is the entire compute unit memory: 2GB. When deploying service as part of the worker default is: computeUnits * 2GB / (amount of services in the worker). Format: [number][whitespace?][B] where ? is an optional field and B is one of the following: kB, KB, kiB, KiB, KIB, mB, MB, miB, MiB, MIB, gB, GB, giB, GiB, GIB

overrideModules.title: Overrides
overrideModules.description: A map of modules to override

effects.description: Effects configuration. Only providers can allow and control effector modules by changing the nox configuration. Properties in this config are ignored when you deploy your code

binaries.description: A map of binary executable files that module is allowed to call. Example: curl: /usr/bin/curl

repl.description: REPL configuration. Properties in this config are ignored when you deploy your code

loggerEnabled.description: Set true to allow module to use the Marine SDK logger

loggingMask.description: manages the logging targets, that are described in detail here: https://fluence.dev/docs/marine-book/marine-rust-sdk/developing/logging#using-target-map

effects.description: Effects configuration. Only providers can allow and control effector modules by changing the nox configuration. Properties in this config are ignored when you deploy your code

binaries.description: A map of binary executable files that module is allowed to call. Example: curl: /usr/bin/curl

loggingMask.description: manages the logging targets, that are described in detail here: https://fluence.dev/docs/marine-book/marine-rust-sdk/developing/logging#using-target-map

Service_name.title: Service config
Service_name.description: Service config. Defines where the service is and how to deploy it

get.description: Path to service directory or URL to the tar.gz archive with the service

totalMemoryLimit.description: Memory limit for all service modules. If you specify this property please make sure it's at least `2 MiB * numberOfModulesInTheService`. In repl default is the entire compute unit memory: 2GB. When deploying service as part of the worker default is: computeUnits * 2GB / (amount of services in the worker). Format: [number][whitespace?][B] where ? is an optional field and B is one of the following: kB, KB, kiB, KiB, KIB, mB, MB, miB, MiB, MIB, gB, GB, giB, GiB, GIB

overrideModules.title: Overrides
overrideModules.description: A map of modules to override

effects.description: Effects configuration. Only providers can allow and control effector modules by changing the nox configuration. Properties in this config are ignored when you deploy your code

binaries.description: A map of binary executable files that module is allowed to call. Example: curl: /usr/bin/curl

repl.description: REPL configuration. Properties in this config are ignored when you deploy your code

loggerEnabled.description: Set true to allow module to use the Marine SDK logger

loggingMask.description: manages the logging targets, that are described in detail here: https://fluence.dev/docs/marine-book/marine-rust-sdk/developing/logging#using-target-map

loggingMask.description: manages the logging targets, that are described in detail here: https://fluence.dev/docs/marine-book/marine-rust-sdk/developing/logging#using-target-map

hosts.description: A map of objects with worker names as keys, each object defines a list of peer IDs to host the worker on. Intended to be used by providers to deploy directly without using the blockchain

services.description: An array of service names to include in this worker. Service names must be listed in fluence.yaml

spells.description: An array of spell names to include in this worker. Spell names must be listed in fluence.yaml

peerIds.description: An array of peer IDs to deploy on

services.description: An array of service names to include in this worker. Service names must be listed in fluence.yaml

spells.description: An array of spell names to include in this worker. Spell names must be listed in fluence.yaml

peerIds.description: An array of peer IDs to deploy on

spells.description: A map with spell names as keys and spell configs as values

aquaFilePath.description: Path to Aqua file which contains an Aqua function that you want to use as a spell

function.description: Name of the Aqua function that you want to use as a spell

initArgs.description: A map of Aqua function arguments names as keys and arguments values as values. They will be passed to the spell function and will be stored in the key-value storage for this particular spell.

clock.description: Trigger the spell execution periodically. If you want to disable this property by overriding it in fluence.yaml - pass empty config for it like this: `clock: {}`

periodSec.description: How often the spell will be executed. If set to 0, the spell will be executed only once. If this value not provided at all - the spell will never be executed

startTimestamp.description: An ISO timestamp when the periodic execution should start. If this property or `startDelaySec` not specified, periodic execution will start immediately. If it is set to 0 - the spell will never be executed

endTimestamp.description: An ISO timestamp when the periodic execution should end. If this property or `endDelaySec` not specified, periodic execution will never end. If it is in the past at the moment of spell creation on Rust peer - the spell will never be executed

startDelaySec.description: How long to wait before the first execution in seconds. If this property or `startTimestamp` not specified, periodic execution will start immediately. WARNING! Currently your computer's clock is used to determine a final timestamp that is sent to the server. This property conflicts with `startTimestamp`. You can specify only one of them

endDelaySec.description: How long to wait before the last execution in seconds. If this property or `endTimestamp` not specified, periodic execution will never end. WARNING! Currently your computer's clock is used to determine a final timestamp that is sent to the server. If it is in the past at the moment of spell creation - the spell will never be executed. This property conflicts with `endTimestamp`. You can specify only one of them

aquaFilePath.description: Path to Aqua file which contains an Aqua function that you want to use as a spell

function.description: Name of the Aqua function that you want to use as a spell

initArgs.description: A map of Aqua function arguments names as keys and arguments values as values. They will be passed to the spell function and will be stored in the key-value storage for this particular spell.

clock.description: Trigger the spell execution periodically. If you want to disable this property by overriding it in fluence.yaml - pass empty config for it like this: `clock: {}`

periodSec.description: How often the spell will be executed. If set to 0, the spell will be executed only once. If this value not provided at all - the spell will never be executed

startTimestamp.description: An ISO timestamp when the periodic execution should start. If this property or `startDelaySec` not specified, periodic execution will start immediately. If it is set to 0 - the spell will never be executed

endTimestamp.description: An ISO timestamp when the periodic execution should end. If this property or `endDelaySec` not specified, periodic execution will never end. If it is in the past at the moment of spell creation on Rust peer - the spell will never be executed

startDelaySec.description: How long to wait before the first execution in seconds. If this property or `startTimestamp` not specified, periodic execution will start immediately. WARNING! Currently your computer's clock is used to determine a final timestamp that is sent to the server. This property conflicts with `startTimestamp`. You can specify only one of them

endDelaySec.description: How long to wait before the last execution in seconds. If this property or `endTimestamp` not specified, periodic execution will never end. WARNING! Currently your computer's clock is used to determine a final timestamp that is sent to the server. If it is in the past at the moment of spell creation - the spell will never be executed. This property conflicts with `endTimestamp`. You can specify only one of them

aquaImports.description: A list of path to be considered by aqua compiler to be used as imports. First dependency in the list has the highest priority. Priority of imports is considered in the following order: imports from --import flags, imports from aquaImports property in fluence.yaml, project's .fluence/aqua dir, npm dependencies from fluence.yaml, npm dependencies from user's .fluence/config.yaml, npm dependencies recommended by fluence

marineBuildArgs.description: Space separated `cargo build` flags and args to pass to marine build. Can be overridden using --marine-build-args flag Default: --release

cliVersion.description: The version of the Fluence CLI that is compatible with this project. Set this to enforce a particular set of versions of all fluence components

ipfsAddr.description: IPFS multiaddress to use when uploading workers with 'fluence deploy'. Default: /dns4/ipfs.fluence.dev/tcp/5001 or /ip4/127.0.0.1/tcp/5001 if using local local env (for 'workers deploy' IPFS address provided by relay that you are connected to is used)

customFluenceEnv.description: Custom Fluence environment to use when connecting to Fluence network

contractsEnv.description: Contracts environment to use for this fluence network to sign contracts on the blockchain

relays.description: List of custom relay multiaddresses to use when connecting to Fluence network

defaultSecretKeyName.description: Secret key with this name will be used by default by js-client inside CLI to run Aqua code

relaysPath.description: Single or multiple paths to the directories where you want relays.json file to be generated. Must be relative to the project root dir. This file contains a list of relays to use when connecting to Fluence network and depends on the default environment that you use in your project

aquaDependencies.description: A map of npm aqua dependency versions

npm-aqua-dependency-name.description: Valid npm dependency version specification (check out https://docs.npmjs.com/cli/v10/configuring-npm/package-json#dependencies)

compileAqua.description: A map of aqua files to compile

input.description: Relative path to the aqua file or directory with aqua files

output.description: Relative path to the output directory

constants.description: A list of constants to pass to the compiler. Constant name must be uppercase

logLevel.description: Log level for the compiler. Default: info

noRelay.description: Do not generate a pass through the relay node. Default: false

noXor.description: Do not generate a wrapper that catches and displays errors. Default: false

tracing.description: Compile aqua in tracing mode (for debugging purposes). Default: false

noEmptyResponse.description: Do not generate response call if there are no returned values. Default: false

input.description: Relative path to the aqua file or directory with aqua files

output.description: Relative path to the output directory

constants.description: A list of constants to pass to the compiler. Constant name must be uppercase

logLevel.description: Log level for the compiler. Default: info

noRelay.description: Do not generate a pass through the relay node. Default: false

noXor.description: Do not generate a wrapper that catches and displays errors. Default: false

tracing.description: Compile aqua in tracing mode (for debugging purposes). Default: false

noEmptyResponse.description: Do not generate response call if there are no returned values. Default: false

deployments.description: A map with deployment names as keys and deployments as values

services.description: An array of service names to include in this worker. Service names must be listed in fluence.yaml

spells.description: An array of spell names to include in this worker. Spell names must be listed in fluence.yaml

computeUnits.description: Number of compute units you require. 1 compute unit = 2GB. Currently the only allowed value is 1. This will change in the future. Default: 1

minWorkers.description: Required workers to activate the deal. Matches target workers by default

maxWorkersPerProvider.description: Max workers per provider. Matches target workers by default

pricePerWorkerEpoch.description: Price per worker epoch in USDC

initialBalance.description: Initial balance after deploy in USDC. Default: targetWorkers * pricePerWorkerEpoch * minDealDepositedEpochs. For local environment: enough for deal to be active for 1 day

effectors.description: Effector CIDs to be used in the deal. Must be a valid CID

whitelist.description: Whitelist of providers to deploy to. Can't be used together with blacklist

blacklist.description: Blacklist of providers to deploy to. Can't be used together with whitelist

services.description: An array of service names to include in this worker. Service names must be listed in fluence.yaml

spells.description: An array of spell names to include in this worker. Spell names must be listed in fluence.yaml

computeUnits.description: Number of compute units you require. 1 compute unit = 2GB. Currently the only allowed value is 1. This will change in the future. Default: 1

minWorkers.description: Required workers to activate the deal. Matches target workers by default

maxWorkersPerProvider.description: Max workers per provider. Matches target workers by default

pricePerWorkerEpoch.description: Price per worker epoch in USDC

initialBalance.description: Initial balance after deploy in USDC. Default: targetWorkers * pricePerWorkerEpoch * minDealDepositedEpochs. For local environment: enough for deal to be active for 1 day

effectors.description: Effector CIDs to be used in the deal. Must be a valid CID

whitelist.description: Whitelist of providers to deploy to. Can't be used together with blacklist

blacklist.description: Blacklist of providers to deploy to. Can't be used together with whitelist

title: fluence.yaml
description: Defines Fluence Project, most importantly - what exactly you want to deploy and how. You can use `fluence init` command to generate a template for new Fluence project
